newsitem.title: JAPAN: Pace of rise in Japan surplus to slow in autumn--EPA.
newsitem.headline: Pace of rise in Japan surplus to slow in autumn--EPA.

text.p: The pace of rises in Japan's trade surplus is likely to slow from the autumn, Economic Planning Agency Minister Taro Aso said on Tuesday.
Aso told a news conference that rises in Japan's trade surplus in the April-June period had been large but that these increases had been predicted and were not that much of a surprise.
Asked if the trade surplus would continue to rise dramatically from the autumn, Aso said: "It is hard to think that the surplus will rise with its current vigour."
He added that the yen had risen one yen to the dollar overnight and that a rise of one yen could make a large difference to some firms.
